column5: i got out for musky opener yesterday... me and some friends (12 guys in 6 boats) had a little buddies tournament... 10 bucks a peice and longest musky takes it all... 120 bucks  out of the 12 guys fishing only 4 musky were caught but my boat got 2 of em  my partner managed 2 small musky 30 and 32 inches  the other 2 were from one other boat as well  36 and 42 inches  so we didnt win but it felt good to be a successful boat  "I" managed 2 small pike and i almost lost track of follows... almost!!!  i had 12 follows!!!!!!!!!! no takers... but thats what keeps us musky hunters coming back  anyways... here are the pics
Nice  Great that you had the successful boat, and got out with some friends
Nice muskies there! You could catch a huge one there. Even the big ones will hit a bucktail or musky spinnerbait.  Thanks for pictures.
Nice going sounds like a great time not much better then that getting out fishing and handing over the cash. Now for next time yours to take back.
It's always fun to get a bunch of buds together for a little friendly tourney to keep things interesting. We've done it a few times too and it makes for a great weekend.

I found the tournament aspect of the day helped to give us the drive to fish hard...  On musky opener you need all the help your body can get... Casting half pound lures all day (6am-10pm) and bouncing in waves coming off a 30 foot cruiser takes it's toll on the body...  I shoulda hit the gym this winter... Shoulder is a bit tender today...
Great start to the season Mike Always nice to be able to boat a few on opener Thanks for sharing Leechman
The "friendly" fishing tournaments are the best! Always a good time, the bragging rights are worth way more than the money!!!  Contrats on a good opener.
Looks like a good time... A friendly tourny among friends is always a fun way to spice things up and keep people fishing hard!
12 follows!!   At least you got a couple in the boat...good job
Nice muskies! Fishing in little tournaments like that are always fun
SWEET....  Now come on down here the last week of June and score on the Niagara River around Strawberry Island....
